intro: Campylanthus spinosus, commonly known as the spiny campylanthus, is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is native to the western United States. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its spiny stems and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
